image.alt: Rutgers School of Dental Medicine — caring clinicians and students providing patient care

Home.title: Welcome to Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

paragraphs.text: We are New Jersey’s only dental school and the state’s largest provider of oral healthcare. We educate the next generation of practitioners, conduct pioneering research, and treat patients in New Jersey and around the world.
Our students train on diverse and medically complex cases across specialties. The school emphasizes clinical excellence, research, and community programs that expand access to care.

items.title: Only NJ Dental School

image.alt: Clinical training and community denture program at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

items.text: As New Jersey’s only dental school, we offer unmatched clinical variety and complex case experience for students and patients.

items.title: High Clinical Volume

image.alt: High patient volume and clinical training at Rutgers SDM

items.text: Our high clinical volume gives students broad experience and patients access to comprehensive care across specialties.

items.title: Research & Innovation

image.alt: Research and innovation at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

items.text: Funded research programs inform clinical practice and help us deliver care based on emerging science and technology.

items.title: Community Programs

image.alt: Community outreach and pediatric care programs run by Rutgers SDM

items.text: Outreach clinics, specialty services, and mission work expand access to care for seniors, veterans, children, and special-needs patients.

paragraphs.text: Kendal Major is a periodontist and respected educator whose career spans clinical leadership and public service. Trained in RSDM’s residency program, he was the first periodontist in the Bahamas and later served in elected office. His combination of surgical skill, global perspective, and commitment to excellence guides the care and teaching he provides.

image.alt: Dr. Kendal Major, periodontist and faculty at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

paragraphs.text: Dr. Daniel H. Fine is an oral biologist whose team has followed thousands of Newark children to study a rare, aggressive form of periodontitis. His research, supported by a major NIH grant, focuses on saliva biomarkers that may predict bone loss and improve early detection and prevention.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel H. Fine, oral biologist and faculty at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

paragraphs.text: Nina O'Connell appears in faculty and news features highlighting teaching and outreach. Her work exemplifies the school’s focus on community service, clinical instruction, and student mentorship.

image.alt: Nina O'Connell featured in Rutgers School of Dental Medicine news

paragraphs.text: Dr. Elisa Velazquez is a pediatric dentist and former RSDM resident whose practice emphasizes empathy, interdisciplinary care, and treatment for children with special needs. Her patient-focused approach grew from training at RSDM and continues through local pediatric practice leadership.

image.alt: Dr. Elisa Velazquez, pediatric dentist and RSDM alumna

paragraphs.text: George McLaughlin, an associate clinical professor, brings decades of clinical experience and teaching to RSDM students. He emphasizes people skills alongside clinical competence to prepare students for successful careers.

image.alt: George McLaughlin, associate clinical professor at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

paragraphs.text: Michael Mohr combined a background in photography with dental training at RSDM, bringing empathy and strong patient communication to his clinical work. His experience shows how diverse backgrounds enrich patient care and education.

image.alt: Michael Mohr, RSDM student featured in school stories

paragraphs.text: Student doctor Stephanie Pagin-Schmidt is highlighted for patient-centered care and dedication. Her attentive approach helped a patient overcome fear and complete restorative treatment with confidence.

image.alt: Stephanie Pagin-Schmidt, student dentist at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

paragraphs.text: Dean Cecile A. Feldman is an advocate for student debt relief and access to care. Her leadership at RSDM focuses on policy, education, and initiatives that help graduates serve the underserved.

image.alt: Dean Cecile A. Feldman, Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

paragraphs.text: Dr. Martin Nweeia blends dental science with marine mammal biology. His research on narwhal tusks illustrates the breadth of scholarship at RSDM and the school’s commitment to interdisciplinary inquiry.

image.alt: Dr. Martin Nweeia speaking about narwhal research and dental science

paragraphs.text: Dr. Louis DiPede’s work highlights global exchange programs and broad clinical training. Faculty like Dr. DiPede help students prepare for diverse practice environments and collaborative care.

image.alt: Dr. Louis DiPede featured in Rutgers School of Dental Medicine stories

paragraphs.text: William Cinotti helped establish CODE clinics and was a mentor to students and alumni. His legacy of service and scholarship remains central to RSDM’s mission to train clinicians who serve their communities.

image.alt: William Cinotti, Rutgers School of Dental Medicine leader and mentor

paragraphs.text: Dr. Rosa Chaviano leads cultural competency and communication training at RSDM. She teaches students to reflect on assumptions and improve patient care by understanding diverse backgrounds and needs.

image.alt: Dr. Rosa Chaviano, assistant dean and faculty at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine

paragraphs.text: From restorative dentures and prosthodontics to complex orthodontics, periodontal surgery, and pediatric specialty care, our clinics provide a wide range of services delivered by supervised student clinicians and faculty.

image.alt: Dentures and prosthodontic services at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine
Orthodontics, braces and complex case care at Rutgers SDM
Periodontal surgery and advanced periodontal care training at Rutgers SDM
Pediatric dental care and cleft palate outreach from Rutgers SDM

testimonials.author: Helen Mason
testimonials.testimonial: “I love my dentures and it would have been a hardship for me to afford them. They are a big improvement in my life.”

testimonials.author: Deborah Bishop
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Stephanie is one of the most professional, astute, knowledgeable, kind and caring people that I have met in a long time.”

testimonials.author: Glenn Ford
testimonials.testimonial: Glenn Ford received comprehensive care through the Vet Smiles Program and regained function and confidence after extensive tooth loss.

image.alt: Rutgers SDM video and media highlights

og_meta.title: Rutgers School of Dental Medicine
og_meta.description: Rutgers School of Dental Medicine provides clinical care, research, and community programs across specialties.

image.alt: Team of dental and faculty professionals together in a bright clinical environment

paragraphs.text: As the only dental school in New Jersey, we treat diverse and medically complex cases across specialties, learning beyond the textbook while delivering clinical expertise and patient-centered care. We emphasize teamwork, clinical excellence, and a welcoming environment that supports patients and trains future clinicians.

We strive to make care accessible and compassionate. Our faculty and students collaborate across disciplines to provide informed, modern treatment while preparing the next generation of dental professionals.

Through community outreach, global missions, and focused clinical programs, Rutgers School of Dental Medicine serves underserved populations and advances oral health through education, research, and service.

image.alt: Dean Cecile A. Feldman

paragraphs.text: Cecile A. Feldman, D.D.S., serves as Dean of Rutgers School of Dental Medicine and is an outspoken advocate on reducing student debt. Her work highlights how student indebtedness affects access to care and the dental workforce, arguing that manageable debt can enable more graduates to serve underserved communities.

image.alt: Dean Cecile A. Feldman
Faculty training program participants

paragraphs.text: Andrew Sullivan, D.D.S., serves as Interim Chair of Periodontics and has trained in periodontal laser surgery, including the LANAP protocol. His work includes adopting digital laser technologies to provide less invasive periodontal procedures and to improve patient outcomes.

image.alt: LANAP training and faculty
Dr. Thomas J. Cangialosi

paragraphs.text: Thomas J. Cangialosi, D.D.S., chair of the Department of Orthodontics, is known for treating complex craniofacial cases. His care can include collaboration with oral surgeons, use of mini-implants, and multi-year coordinated treatment plans to restore function and appearance in severe cases.
One cited case involved treatment for Treacher Collins Syndrome, where combined surgical and orthodontic care dramatically improved speech, eating, and quality of life for the patient.

image.alt: After treatment photo related to Dr. Cangialosi's case study
Dr. Martin Nweeia

paragraphs.text: Martin Nweeia, D.M.D., D.D.S., is a clinician-scientist with interdisciplinary research interests, including marine-mammal biology. His profile highlights work that bridges clinical practice and scientific inquiry, bringing unique perspectives to dental research and education.

image.alt: Dr. Martin Nweeia and research imagery
Kendal Major

paragraphs.text: Kendal Major trained in periodontics after earning his BA from Tuskegee University and studying at Howard University College of Dentistry. He returned to the Bahamas to open a practice and has combined clinical care with public service ambitions to uplift his community.
Major credits his training at Rutgers with shaping his professional standards of excellence and professionalism and remains committed to clinical care and community leadership.

image.alt: Kendal Major in ceremonial attire
Elisa Velazquez at work

paragraphs.text: Elisa Velazquez, RSDM alumna, co-owns Ocean Pediatric Dental Associates and completed a pediatric residency at RSDM. She emphasizes empathy, interdisciplinary collaboration, and specialized care for children, including those with special needs.

Velazquez serves as staff dentist for Children’s Specialized Hospital and is vice-president of the New Jersey Academy of Pediatric Dentistry, applying her training to clinical practice and community leadership.

image.alt: Elisa Velazquez in practice
Clinical surgery team image

paragraphs.text: Shahid Aziz performs cleft lip and palate surgeries through twice-yearly mission trips, helping more than 1,000 patients from Bangladesh and forming his own non-profit, Smile Bangladesh. His work restores function and social opportunity for patients who otherwise lack access to care.
Aziz collaborates with residents and organizations like Smile Train to deliver life-changing reconstructive surgeries in resource-limited settings.

image.alt: Surgical mission clinical scene
Orthodontics resident clinical image

paragraphs.text: Shenjunti Choudhary, an orthodontics resident born in Bangladesh with a cleft palate repaired on a mission trip, was inspired by that experience to pursue orthodontics. Her journey highlights how outreach programs change lives and motivate future clinicians.

image.alt: Orthodontic resident in clinic
George McLaughlin

paragraphs.text: George McLaughlin, associate clinical professor in Restorative Dentistry, has a background in engineering and a long career in dentistry and teaching. He emphasizes people skills and professionalism, and has been active in civil rights and community advocacy throughout his life.

image.alt: George McLaughlin with colleagues
Stephanie Pagin-Schmidt

paragraphs.text: Student Doctor Stephanie Pagin‑Schmidt served at the CODE center in Pomona, providing compassionate denture care to underserved patients. Her dedication included multiple long trips to complete a patient's treatment, demonstrating commitment to continuity of care and patient comfort.

image.alt: Student doctor with patient
Dr. Daniel H. Fine

paragraphs.text: Oral biologist Daniel H. Fine has led longitudinal research tracking adolescents for periodontal disease progression, improving understanding of localized aggressive periodontitis and informing preventive and clinical strategies.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel H. Fine in research context
Dr. Rosa Chaviano

paragraphs.text: Rosa Chaviano, assistant dean of Student Admissions and Recruitment, emphasizes cultural competency in healthcare, guiding students and faculty to examine assumptions and improve communication with patients from diverse backgrounds.

image.alt: Cultural competency in clinical education
Dr. Harry Zohn

paragraphs.text: Dr. Harry Zohn teaches forensic dentistry at RSDM and has focused on how dental identification practices evolved after major disasters, expanding course access to dental professionals and disaster response teams.

image.alt: Dr. Harry Zohn teaching forensic dentistry
Christopher Hughes with students in Tanzania

paragraphs.text: Christopher Hughes, chair of Pediatric Dentistry, has participated in international teaching and service work, including visits to Tanzania to train local clinicians and improve preventive dental care through education and hands-on training.

image.alt: Dr. Hughes teaching abroad

items.bio: Student and testimonial contributor illustrating RSDM’s collaborative culture and patient-centered training.

image.alt: Tishana Foster

items.bio: Student representative featured in RSDM community stories and events.

image.alt: Allison Striano

image.alt: Carla Cugini

image.alt: Vijay Parashar

items.name: Student Doctor Stephanie Pagin‑Schmidt
items.bio: Student clinician known for dedication to underserved patients and continuity of care.

image.alt: Stephanie Pagin-Schmidt

paragraphs.text: Rutgers School of Dental Medicine engages locally and globally to improve access to care. Recent efforts include fundraising events such as the annual hockey match that raised funds for cancer support, and clinical outreach trips that provide cleft lip and palate repairs overseas, restoring function and social opportunity for patients in need.

These programs combine student training with service: faculty and residents lead missions, while students gain hands-on experience in culturally sensitive, high-impact care. Local initiatives also support low-income seniors and community clinics that expand preventive and restorative services.

image.alt: Graphic representing community support and outreach
Schedule an appointment at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine clinics

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Lakeshore Orthodontics front desk

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit starts with a friendly welcome and a chance to meet our team. We will review your health history, take any needed X-rays or photos, and perform a complete orthodontic exam so we can evaluate your bite and discuss treatment options.

We take time to explain findings in plain language, outline recommended next steps, and answer questions about timing, comfort, and maintenance. Come prepared with your insurance card and any recent dental records to speed the process.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We accept many major insurance plans and will file claims electronically when possible to make your visit easier. Our team will verify benefits and explain coverage before any treatment begins.

Flexible payment plans are available for every budget. Ask our treatment coordinator about interest-free options and special offers, including a complimentary consultation to review your personalized plan.
To save time at your appointment, complete new patient forms in advance. We provide printable PDFs and an online intake option so you can choose the most convenient method for your family.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online
Schedule an appointment at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine clinics

seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, first visit, patient forms, financing

og_meta.title: Get Started | Orthodontic Care
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey. Learn what to expect at your first visit, access new patient forms, and schedule a complimentary consultation today.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Custom dentures and prosthodontic care restore chewing, speech, and confidence when teeth are missing. We focus on comfortable, durable options and follow-up care so prosthetics stay comfortable over time.

image.alt: Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Pediatric dentures provide a comfortable, temporary solution for children with missing or underdeveloped teeth. We custom-fit each appliance and plan periodic refits as the child grows, with long-term goals in mind.

image.alt: Young patient holding a retainer and smiling

paragraphs.text: Preventive care for children — including sealants, fluoride varnish, cleanings, and education — reduces cavities and sets healthy habits. Community programs help bring these services to kids who need them most.

image.alt: Modern pediatric dental clinic interior with kid-friendly decor

paragraphs.text: Braces remain a reliable, effective way to correct bite and alignment issues. We offer modern metal and ceramic options and tailor treatment to each patient's goals and lifestyle.
Durable and cost-effective, metal braces use brackets and wires to gently guide teeth into their proper position over time.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic brackets blend with tooth color for a less noticeable appearance while still delivering predictable results.

image.alt: Smiling woman with clear aligner
Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Temporary anchorage devices, or mini-implants, give orthodontists stable points to move teeth that would otherwise be difficult to correct. They are placed and removed as part of a carefully planned treatment.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation with surgical planning materials

paragraphs.text: When jaw discrepancies affect chewing, speech, or facial balance, orthognathic surgery and orthodontics are planned together for the best outcome. Our team coordinates closely with oral surgeons to deliver precise, functional results.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: LANAP is a laser protocol for treating advanced gum disease that often reduces bleeding, swelling, and recovery time compared with traditional surgery. It is an FDA-cleared approach that can be part of a conservative treatment plan for periodontal disease.

image.alt: Digital scanner and modern periodontal technology in a treatment room

paragraphs.text: Cleft lip and palate care requires a team approach that includes surgeons, orthodontists, and speech specialists. We support coordinated repair and long-term follow-up to help children eat, speak, and grow with confidence.

image.alt: Surgical consultation setting for multidisciplinary cleft care
